channel.title: How difficult would this be?
channel.description:
I'm pretty new to coding and mostly been reading through tuts and using them to add to Project Insanity and make it better, which is nice but that really doesn't require much skill at all lol. My question is I would like to change the teleports in the book to portals. For instance I'll have a portal set up and when you click it, it brings up a menu with a few options and you click one and it teleports you. Is this something for more experienced people or could I pull it off?
Thanks

item.title: How difficult would this be?
item.dc:creator: @zRickyz zRickyz
item.description:
@zRickyz wrote:

Thanks buddy I’ll give it a shot

Read full topic

item.title: How difficult would this be?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zRickyz, post:1, topic:442340”]I’m pretty new to coding and mostly been reading through tuts and using them to add to Project Insanity and make it better, which is nice but that really doesn’t require much skill at all lol. My question is I would like to change the teleports in the book to portals. For instance I’ll have a portal set up and when you click it, it brings up a menu with a few options and you click one and it teleports you. Is this something for more experienced people or could I pull it off?

Thanks[/quote]

Not hard at all.

What you would do is code in a portal first off.

Then login as your admin and click the now coded portal. Assuming you set up clicking buttons right. It should show what clicking buttons ID the new portal is.

Then goto clickingbuttons.java, and find the switch statement, or the section with all the case XXXX: things. Add the ID you got above into it as a new case. for example say my portal was ClicingButtons ID 3493.
it would look like this, kind of.
case 3493:
//Code here
break;

That should get you started.

Read full topic
